metadata.title: CVE-2021-35039 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
kernel/module.c in the Linux kernel before 5.12.14 mishandles SignatureVerification, aka CID-0c18f29aae7c. Without CONFIG_MODULE_SIG, verificationthat a kernel module is signed, for loading via init_module, does not occurfor a module.sig_enforce=1 command-line argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-35039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
